title: Taylor Swift Era
description: The debut era that launched Taylor Swift's career with country music roots

title: Fearless Era
description: The era that established Taylor as a crossover artist with her first Grammy-winning album

title: Speak Now Era
description: The era where Taylor wrote every song solo, proving her songwriting abilities

title: Red Era
description: The transitional era that began Taylor's shift from country to pop music

title: 1989 Era
description: The era that marked Taylor's official transition to pop music with a retro 80s influence

title: Reputation Era
description: The darker era that responded to media controversies with a bold new sound

title: Lover Era
description: The colorful era celebrating love and showcasing Taylor's ownership of her music

title: Folklore Era
description: The surprise indie-folk era created during the pandemic with introspective storytelling

title: Evermore Era
description: The sister era to Folklore, continuing the indie-folk sound with wintry themes

title: Midnights Era
description: The era exploring sleepless nights and late-night reflections with a return to pop

title: The Tortured Poets Department Era
description: The latest era featuring poetic explorations of relationships and personal growth
